intro: Malvastrum lobbii, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain wildlife.
